question.text: For technical reasons use the "Long free text" instead of the "text display" template in Limesurvey for Instructions in ROVER that do not need to be answered. The content from the text field in the "Question" tab is displayed on the rating station. TheÂ text from the "Code" field from the "Question" tab is set as title of the instruction in ROVER.

If you enter text in the text field in the "Help" tab, ROVER will generate a button labelled with the text specified there.

Otherwise no button will be generated and the instruction will require investigators to manually progress the study state on the rating station using ROVER's desktop UI. This may be part of the study design.

directive.text:
Always use question type "Array" in Limesurvey, even for single items. The text field in the "Question" tab stays empty/unused.

The "Code" field in General Settings is used for the title of the item set in ROVER. The text from the "Help" text field is the same for every item of the set.

subQuestion.text: The code of your single subquestion is the variable ID of the item in ROVER. The subquestion text field is what is displayed as the item in ROVER. From the "Answer options" tab, the "code" field of an option is the numeric scale label and the text field is the text scale label.

directive.text:
Multi-Item sets work similarly. The "Help" text stays same for all items. As does the title from the "code" field in general settings.

The answer options must be the same for each item of the item set.

We recommend to use a maximum of 10 answer options
